verbose_text: Because Bandyopadhyay et al. [XREF_BIBR] suggested that TGFbetaR2 alone is able to mediate TGFbeta signalling to ERK1/2 without the participation of TGFbetaR1 and that phosphorylation of Tyr 284 in TGFbetaR2 is associated with the activation of non Smad signalling pathways [XREF_BIBR], we analysed the GDF15 elicited TGFbetaR2 activation of tyrosine residues by immunoprecipitation.
